critique: This document pertains to the expansion of the Fort Gulick Military Reservation in the Canal Zone. It is a technical document describing the land being added to the reservation. Given the time period (1942), this likely relates to military preparations during World War II. There is no direct indication of ideological tilt, immigration policy, or social inclusion. The expansion of a military reservation could be seen as a slight expansion of executive power and federal control, and potentially related to national security. There's no direct economic regulation involved.
